documentHeader.documentDescription: DNP3 Device Profile for the OpenDNP3 library

methods.note: OpenDNP3 is a source code library for implementing masters and outstations. Implementers integrating the library should supply their own device profile specific to their device.

other.explanation: Source code library is configurable via configuration structures. Configuration via file is done by the integrator.

capabilities.note: Depends on target hardware
Depends on target hardware.
Type of serial support depends on target platform.
TCP keep-alive values are determined by the target operating system.
OpenDNP3 only supports sending unsolicited null responses to the response port.
OpenDNP3 is extremely scalable. The number of connections supported depends on your OS and OS configuration.
The default address in the library depends on the whether is a master (1) or outstation (1024)

sometimes.explanation: Outstation can be configured to respond to any source address.

capabilities.note: Only for outstations.
File Transfer is not supported.
Outstation supports multiple CROB/AO. Master does not.
Outstation supports multiple CROB/AO. Master does not.
Data Sets are not supported.
Outstation supports multiple CROB/AO. Master does not.
The reference outstation never requests time, however, the opendnp3 library gives users complete control over how often the NEED_TIME IIN bit is asserted.
A method is provided to set the the Device Trouble bit.
Depends on database size/configuration

sometimes.explanation: Confirmation is only needed if the final fragment contains event data
Only when it contains event data

capabilities.note: The reference outstation does not preserve anything through a restart. Callbacks in the opendnp3 library allow device implementors to persist settings in other implementations.
Same value used for solicited responses (1.4.3)
Hold-Time is not supported.
Software implementation only. Depends on target hardware and operating system.
Asserting IIN1.4 is a user code concern. The libary allows setting/unsetting the bit as required.

currentValue.note: Reference implementation never requests time. Underlying library gives full control to the implementor.

capabilities.note: Software implementation only. Depends on target hardware and operating system.
Depends on target hardware and operating system.
Depends on target hardware and implementation.
Depends on target hardware and implementation.
Depends on target hardware and implementation.
Depends on target hardware and implementation.
Integrator defined.
Integrator defined.
Roll-over is defined by the user application. Default rollover is 32-bit representation.
